creator: ran.leibman@gmail.com
text:
Hi Guys,

If I try to deploy a war file via the manager/text to the ROOT context with a version I get an error.

For Example deploying the jenkins webapp to the ROOT context with version 111:
wget -q -O - --user USER --password PASS 'http://localhost:8080/manager/text/deploy?path=/%23%23111&war=file:/tmp/jenkins.war'
FAIL - Failed to deploy application at context path /##111

and also I see in the webapps directory the file ##111.war that wasn't there before


Note:
If I do the same thing on a different context it works,
Also if I do the same thing when path=/ (with no version) it works.

creator: violetagg@apache.org
text:
Hi,

Try to specify the version with a parameter [1].

"path - The context path (including the leading slash) of the web application you are dealing with. To select the ROOT web application, specify "/". NOTE - It is not possible to perform administrative commands on the Manager application itself. 
version - The version of this web application as used by the parallel deployment feature, 
war - URL of a web application archive (WAR) file..."

Regards
Violeta

[1] http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-7.0-doc/manager-howto.html#Supported_Manager_Commands

Can't believe I've missed it !
Thanks and sorry
creator: ran.leibman@gmail.com
